question_sentence: Joe Biden became the first sitting US president to visit which African country?
evidence: The three-day visit – likely to be Biden's final overseas trip before leaving office – was designed to shore up Western influence in the region, where the abundance of valuable minerals has also attracted attention from China. Biden visited a US-funded rail project, which will transport copper, cobalt and lithium for export overseas.

question_sentence: A new study revealed which food lowers the risk of Type 2 diabetes?
evidence: The study, which analysed the diets of 192,000 American adults over 34 years, found that people who consume at least five one-ounce servings of dark chocolate a week had a 21% lower risk of developing Type 2 diabetes. In comparison, milk chocolate offered no such benefits and was linked to a higher risk of weight gain.

question_sentence: This year's Spotify Wrapped offers each user a personalised what, based on their listening habits?
evidence: The new addition to Unwrapped sees two eerily human-like AI podcast hosts dissect your 2024 listening trends. It's one of a host of AI-powered features to be incorporated into Spotify in recent months, leading to fears that the platform's curation is increasingly hemming users into an algorithmic echo chamber.

question_sentence: Tesla's board was stymied by a US federal judge in its attempt to award founder Elon Musk a pay package worth how much?
evidence: Delaware judge Kathaleen McCormick upheld a previous rejection of Musk's eye-popping compensation package, which was ruled to have been improperly negotiated with an insufficiently independent board of directors. Tesla plans to appeal the ruling.

question_sentence: Following their shock takeover of Aleppo, Syrian rebel militias have taken control of which other city?
evidence: On Thursday, it was reported that the Syrian army had been ordered to withdraw from Hama as insurgents marched on the city. The lightning offensive by Syria's rebel factions has caught President Bashar al-Assad off-guard and seems to have been timed to capitalise on the global conflicts distracting his key allies, Iran and Russia.

question_sentence: "Moana 2" set a US box office record over the Thanksgiving weekend, surpassing which other Disney film?
evidence: The Disney sequel broke records by earning $221 million in the US over a five-day period, surpassing Frozen II's $125 million in 2019. It became the highest-grossing film ever released during Thanksgiving weekend.

question_sentence: A feed additive for what type of livestock prompted backlash, boycotts and a Bill Gates conspiracy theory?
evidence: Danish-Swedish dairy giant Arla's decision to trial Bovaer, a supplement shown to reduce cow flatulence, a leading cause of methane output, became the target of conspiracy theories online, with some users erroneously claiming the product is linked to Bill Gates.

question_sentence: Journalists at which UK newspaper went on strike?
evidence: Journalists are on strike at The Guardian and its sister publication, The Observer, to protest the planned sale of the latter to digital news start-up Tortoise Media. They argue that the sale betrays the newspaper's core values and could jeopardise the brand.

question_sentence: How long did South Korea's shock decision to impose martial law last?
evidence: President Yoon Suk Yeol's 11pm declaration of martial law, which he blamed on pro-North Korean sympathisers and anti-state activities inside opposition parties, stunned citizens and prompted immediate panic and protest. Just after 5am, the cabinet voted to rescind the order.

question_sentence: An apparent plastic surgery craze among aspiring Republican insiders has attracted what name?
evidence: Defined by "copious use of Botox, a Miami-bronze tan, puffy lips and silky-smooth skin", a cosmetic makeover appears to have become the latest must-have "accessory" for Donald Trump's more high-profile supporters, the Daily Mail said.

question_sentence: What was recently approved by the federal government regarding offshore wind?
choices: A new offshore wind farm in California
A ban on offshore wind projects
A new regulation for offshore fishing

question_sentence: In Delaware, why is paying rent late grounds for eviction?
choices: It is considered a lease violation
It is a form of property damage

question_sentence: What injury did Sharon Caldwell sustain during her altercation with Dover police officers?
What unique holiday tradition is celebrated in Claymont?
What inspired the new beer collaboration between Dogfish Head and Lloyd's Market?
What is Kelly's Logan House known for?
choices: Being the oldest Irish bar in Delaware
Hosting the largest St. Patrick's Day parade

question_sentence: Why was Lee Hull fired as the football coach of Delaware State Hornets?
What was the median home price in Delaware in October 2024?
What is the focus of the Consortium Discipline Alternative Program in Delaware?
What will replace the Rodeway Inn in Newark?
choices: A Dash In convenience store with gas station and car wash

question_sentence: Which airport is facing scrutiny after a stowaway breached TSA security checkpoints and made it onto a flight?
evidence: A Russian woman who stowed away on a Delta Air Lines flight from New York to Paris last week was arrested on Wednesday. The shocking breach has drawn attention to security lapses at New York's John F. Kennedy International Airport.

question_sentence: Which issue took center stage at the Supreme Court this week?
evidence: The Supreme Court is hearing a historic case that could determine whether states can restrict gender-affirming care for minors. A decision is expected by July 2025.

question_sentence: A tsunami warning was issued for which major city in the Western US this week?
evidence: Tsunami warnings were issued for millions of people along parts of the Northern California and Oregon coastlines after a 7.0-magnitude earthquake struck off the California coast on Thursday. The alert — which included San Francisco and the Bay area — was later canceled after authorities said no significant change was recorded on shore.

question_sentence: Which cryptocurrency recently hit a record $100,000 for the first time?
evidence: Bitcoin surged to a record high this week as President-elect Donald Trump prepares to usher in crypto-friendly policies when he takes office in January.

question_sentence: Which country plunged into political chaos this week after its president declared martial law?
evidence: South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol declared martial law on Tuesday but was forced to lift the decree amid widespread condemnation. Martial law refers to granting the military temporary rule during an emergency, which the president has the constitutional ability to declare. But the announcement hit like a bombshell, sending shock waves through the democratic nation.

question_sentence: What is the name of the farthest spacecraft from Earth?
evidence: NASA’s Voyager 1 is currently exploring uncharted territory more than 15 billion miles away from Earth. Engineers recently restored contact with the deep-space probe after its dwindling power supply caused a weekslong blackout.

question_sentence: One of President-elect Donald Trump’s Cabinet picks, Pete Hegseth, is under scrutiny following allegations of past misconduct. Which department was Hegseth tapped to lead?
evidence: Pete Hegseth, a veteran and former Fox News host, is Donald Trump’s pick for defense secretary. He is facing questions about his fitness to lead the Pentagon due to allegations of past misconduct, including a sexual assault allegation from 2017, which he has denied.

question_sentence: Which country did President Joe Biden visit this week?
evidence: During a three-day trip to Africa — the first for an American president — Biden promoted US investment in a massive railway project aiming to ease the transport of critical minerals to global markets.

question_sentence: Travelers in the US lose millions of suitcases every year. Which state has the only store dedicated to selling the contents of unclaimed baggage lost in transit?
evidence: The contents of millions of suitcases lost by US airlines end up at the Unclaimed Baggage store in Scottsboro, Alabama.

question_sentence: Which musician was named the greatest pop star of the 21st century by Billboard?
evidence: Beyoncé has been named the greatest pop star of the 21st century by Billboard, ahead of Taylor Swift at No. 2 and Rihanna at No. 3.
